document.docAuthor: Guimarães, Jorge A., Gallardo, Fabiana E., Diaz, Norma Beatriz & Zucchi, Roberto A.
document.masterDocTitle: Eucoilinae species (Hymenoptera: Cynipoidea: Figitidae) parasitoids of fruit­infesting dipterous larvae in Brazil: identity, geographical distribution and host associations

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Eucoilinae species (Hymenoptera: Cynipoidea: Figitidae) parasitoids of fruit­infesting dipterous larvae in Brazil: identity, geographical distribution and host associations

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cothonaspis ( Cothonaspis ) boulardi
Barbotin, Carton & Kelner­Pillaut, 1979
: 20
Leptopilina boulardi
;
Nordlander 1980
: 432

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hosts. Drosophilidae :
Drosophila melanogaster
( in
Nordlander 1980
). This species was collected from dipterous puparia in rotten fruits fallen on the ground.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 56–63.
Leptopilina boulardi .
56. Head, anterior view (407x, 20 m); 57. Female antenna (309x, 20 m); 58. Flagellomerous 1 and 2 of male (267x, 20 m); 59. Pronotal plate (790x, 20 m); 60. Head, mesosoma and anterior part of metasoma, lateral view (100x, 100 m); 61. Mesosoma, dorsal view (335x, 20 m); 62. Forewing (10x, 0.14mm); 63. Metacoxa (230x, 100 m).

Remarks.
Leptopilina
Förster, 1869
is a cosmopolitan genus, which includes about 10 species (
Nordlander 1980
).
L. bourladi
is the only species of this genus recorded in Brazil .
